result.pre: directly to respiratory samples to detect influenza virus and generate
result.post: sequences. The approach demonstrates excellent specificity; sensitivity varies by

result.pre: demonstrating the ability of metagenomics to produce sufficient data for
result.post: diagnostics and genome characterisation, whilst also detecting and sequencing

result.pre: resistance alleles. IDSA guidelines [ 9] recommend nasal/nasopharyngeal specimens for
result.post: diagnosis, but throat swabs are easier to collect in

result.pre: clinical diagnostics to further assess sensitivity and specificity, and using
result.post: sequence data to investigate transmission events. Identifying instances of
